metadata.titel_preek: A Sound Word For A New Year

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher describes the grim socio-political mood of 1975, compares it to the historical context of the book of Daniel (Antiochus IV Epiphanes), and explains the call to wait and endure until the end.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong historical-critical awareness; uses the concept of 'parable' and 'abomination of desolation' to bridge ancient text and modern anxiety.

illocutie.beschrijving: The sermon begins by ASSERTING the state of the world, moves to COMMANDING endurance, and culminates in PROMISING God's presence and future restoration.
voorbeelden: I suppose that is what my sermon is all about (Asserting)
Wait on the Lord (Commanding/Directive)
I will be with you (Promising/Commissive)

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from apprehension and 'grim' uncertainty to a state of hopeful endurance and 'rest'.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the preacher acts as a conduit for the 'word from the Lord' but does not explicitly invoke the Spirit's internal work.

voorbeelden: The mood is grim, fearful, apprehensive.
A heathen and arrogant overlord and his proud and powerful army were in control.
The center of the world's wealth may be changing.
Wait on the Lord.
Go thou thy way until the end.
Do not stop halfway.
I wish... we could greet one another in the bright hopefulness of 1965.
I felt that here very strongly.
I will be with you.
I will give you the morning star.
I will lead you to living fountains.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High; the preacher shifts from 'talking about' God to quoting Christ's direct promises to the hearer.

voorbeelden: Blessed is he that waiteth.
Thou shalt rest.
God shall wipe away all tears.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher uses the authority of the text to declare a new status (blessedness) over the weary hearer.

indicatoren: Extensive historical review of 1955, 1965, and 1975 politics.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed about the crisis but may feel the 'event' is delayed by the long sociological introduction.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The sermon successfully transitions into performative mode in the final third.

voorbeelden: In trials and tears, the promise stands.
Christ says, 'I will give you the morning star.'

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal observation and pastoral identification ('I talked', 'I felt').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation ('I pass it on to you', 'You weary one').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used heavily in the final promises and commands.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the nation, the historical Daniel, and the 'abomination'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a necessary distance to analyze the 'grim' reality before closing the gap.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Historical context of 1955-1975 and the Seleucid Empire.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General theological truths ('God still holds the reins').

actueel_present.gebruik: The immediate address to the 'weary one' in the pews.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the Assertive (The world is grim) to the Declarative (Blessed is he who waits) to the Commissive (Christ will be with you) to the Directive (Try on, pray on).
voorbeelden: The promise stands... God shall wipe away all tears... therefore... try on, pray on.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent transition from indicative to imperative.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because 'the promise stands', you can 'work on, believe on'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: While heavily weighted toward description in the first half, the sermon successfully 'happens' in the second half by moving from talking about God to speaking for God.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: In trials and tears, the promise stands.
sterke_punten.effect: Creates a foundation of security for the hearer.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long list of political failures in the first 5 paragraphs.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Risks becoming a political commentary rather than a sermon.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when the preacher stops analyzing 1975 and starts applying the 'Blessed' declaration of Daniel.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of 'The promise stands' functions as a means of grace.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, especially in the final section where Christ's words are quoted as current reality.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher explicitly asks if there is a 'word from the Lord', positioning himself as a messenger.
tekstueel_bewijs: I pass it on to you this New Year's Sunday morning.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Implicitly through the 'inspired author' and the 'spiritualist movements' contrast.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher leaves the 'rising and singing' to the hearer's response to the word.
tekstueel_bewijs: An author inspired of God dipped his pen...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon functions as a 'Sound Word' that provides what it describes (rest).
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: The shift to 'I will give you the morning star' is epiphanic.
tekstueel_bewijs: God's great hour for you is bound to come.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is/was' (Assertive) but finishes strong with 'will/shall' (Commissive/Declarative).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Christian person wants to know... if there is any word from the Lord.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Hear now the word of the Lord for you today.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a description of desire to the fulfillment of the act.

voorbeeldzinnen: This promise is for you, right now, in your specific grief.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'we' and 'the nation' in the beginning.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interject direct address ('You') earlier in the sociological analysis.
voorbeeldzinnen: You feel this uncertainty in your own home.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of how a sermon can move from the 'grim' constative reality of the world to the 'blessed' performative reality of the Kingdom.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' of anxiety; SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the word to change the hearer's status.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'We shall overcome' quote for its eloquence; SAT critiques it as a failed human commissive, contrasted with God's infallible commissive.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power isn't in the description of 1975, but in the illocutionary act of 'passing on' the blessing of Daniel.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Moralistic' trap by grounding its 'Directives' (try on, pray on) in the 'Commissives' (the promise stands).
